title: Deleting email message for one account in Unified Inbox does not clear 'unread messages' bubble.
content:
Hi, I'm new to Thunderbird and am running 102.15.0 (64-bit) under Windows 10. To keep things simple I do 90% of my mail chores using just the Unified Folders to minimize clutter in that left pane. When I read mail, the count of unread messages drops with each one opened or deleted. But when all have been dealt with I still have a bold blue listing with a yellow ball for the Unified Inbox and for one email account (only), even though the number countdown to the right of the account name is now gone.

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-09-02-15-41-12-d08876.png

To clear the situation I have to call All Folders into that left pane (that account's own folder is blue-with-a-bullet also) and simply open the subject account folder. The blue bold name and yellow ball immediately disappear, both for that folder and for the Unified Inbox.

I'm hoping this is just some setting I've overlooked, but I do have all three email accounts set exactly the same, and only one of them exhibits this behavior. Thanks in advance for any tips.

title: Gmail is not downloading to TB properly -- 2 different problems
content:
Hello, and thank you for your time,

I've been using TB for more than 10 years, I love it, but although I have been making a living using computers for decades (I write indexes for books), I'm not a super-tech person. The problem is occurring on a Win10 system. I use POP by strong preference, and I have TB v 102.15.0 (64 bit) recently upgraded, but the problems were evident on the previous 102.14 version, not sure if previous to that one. I have Gmail set to delete emails from gmail once they have been accessed with POP.

My Inbox in TB was very full, I deleted the 11,000+ emails and have compacted files. When the problem occurred a few weeks ago, I probably had 8,000 emails in it. Could a crowded INBOX be a source for either or both the problems below?

Two problems that have developed fairly recently:

1) A group of emails are visible when I check Gmail with the app on my phone, but they do not download into TB. The first time this happened none of the trapped emails were important, but this time there are client emails. I will deal with these one at a time, but I need to know what is wrong and how to avoid this.

2) Despite clearing the Inbox and Compacting, right now, TB will not download more than about 24 emails at a time. To get all my email from gmail, I have to repeatedly check mail.  ???? It's been true for a while that TB seems to sequester groups of emails and doesn't download everything all at once, but it would normally show that there were say, 255 emails on gmail, but would only download largish some portion of those. I would tell it to check again and again until all are downloaded into TB. Now, it doesn't "see" all the emails on gmail, it only says it sees 24 or so at a time, downloads those, and then I have to tell it to get mail again.

[BONUS ISSUE] 3) Sometimes, even though email has been downloaded into TB, one or more emails doesn't get deleted from Gmail.

This is so confusing, and I've been limping along with it. Any help on this would be much appreciated.

Sincerely, --Victoria
creator: Victoria-nola

title: Unable to send more than 50 emails at a time via mail merge
content: We recently updated to the newest Thunderbird version, but since then, we have been experiencing an issue where we can't send more than 50 emails. The mail server responded: too many messages in this connection. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again". We checked that the settings are all correct. We didn't have to reset those settings after upgrading. I believe that once we installed the new versions, the settings carried over from the old one, yet we are unable to send mail merges for over than 51 emails.

title: Backup andRestore Local Folders
content:
Thunderbird urgently needs a simple process to Backup & Restore important Folders and Emails stored in Local Folders. These are effectively deleted from the host server once moved into Local Folders, so can't be retrieved from the host.

Thunderbird should provide a simple Backup & Restore process that allows users to select specific folders, or All folders stored in Local Folders. It should permit users to nominate where to store these backed up folders - eg. external disc.

On the Restore side, it would be ideal if the backed up emails in the Local folders were added, rather than replaced emails stored in the Local Folders - in case more had been added since the Backup was taken. An option for replace or ignore duplicates would be desirable.

The Backup and Restore functions should be added to the standard Thunderbird Menus - perhaps under Tools.

Would Mozilla consider adding such a function as it is an important shortcoming in the curent system?
creator: graeme.hurst16

title: Stop threading, ditch 'Correspondents' and arrange all emails in descending date order
content: Many times now, I have needed to change folder views to 'Unthreaded', ditch 'Correspondents' in favour of 'From' and 'Recipient' and arrange my emails in descending date order. Every time I create a new folder, I need to go through the same routine. Every time I download a new version of Thunderbird, all my folders are changed back to 'Threaded' and 'Correspondents' and are in Ascending date order, so I have to go through the whole process again. What I need is a simple 'global' setting in a menu, so that I can change the settings for ALL my Thunderbird folders in a simple series of clicks, without needing to go to each folder every time. Better still would be a 'once for all' fix that would prevent Thunderbird changing my settings every time I download a new version. There must be thousands of Thunderbird users who share my frustration with what is lotherwise an excellent email program. Please fix it!
creator: blackberrylane.co.uk

title: [SOLUTION] : Thunderbird and Gmail authentication
content:
Hi - I am posting a solution to a frustrating problem that I had a few days back and how I solved it.

This is one a bit technical (read: hard to find) so please bear with me.

Problem: Authentication failure while connecting to imap.gmail.com

Assumption: I am assuming that you have put the settings of the server exactly how Gmail requires you to give in Thunderbird.

I am also assuming that the authentication dialog comes up and you are able to allow Thunderbird an access on the Google authentication page and yet Thunderbird responds with authentication failure.

Also, I am assuming that there's no antivirus/firewall blocking communication with Gmail or Thunderbird app itself.


Solution: Check of you have IIS or Apache or anything else running on port 80 - basically - if typing http://localhost on the browser shows something.

You see, after authentication from Google, Thunderbird tries to go back to http://localhost - and it expects to find itself BUT it finds your already running web server itself.

I resolved my problem by ensuring no webserver is running at the time of authentication and that solved my issue.

Hope this helps someone.

Nirav
creator: nkaku

title: "Insert Signature" option would be nice.
content:
Thunderbird's Signature feature is nice; I especially like how easy it is to create a nice-looking signature with graphics from within T'bird itself... no HTML editor required. Each of my email accounts can have it own signature, customized for home, work or whatever. Great!

But my complaint is that the signature is at the very bottom of the email, not immediately following my written message. In other words:

Hi, Jack, 

  Thanks for your note. I'll get on this right away

(followed by Jack's scathing admonition of my tardiness in completing the project) Best regards, 

  Jim

It would be really nice to be able to insert the HTML signature with a keystroke, rather than accepting its placement at the very bottom. As it is, I am able to highlight the entire HTML signature, Ctrl+X it to the Windows clipboard, then Ctrl+V it where I want it. But that's an extra step. Moreover, there are emails in which I'd rather not put the signature, which means it has to be deleted before sending. Just saying...

title: All Thunderbird profiles disappeared after update
content:
Dear Community,

My operating system: Windows 11 (version 22H2, OS build 22621.2134).

My Thunderbird version: 102.15.0, first offered to channel users on August 30, 2023.

After my computer apparently uploaded a new version of Thunderbird two days ago, my profiles (and emails, etc.) are no longer visible. The program simply cannot find any of my profiles anymore. This is the second time that this has happened to me this year. Only my address book is still visible within the program when I click on the appropriate icon on the left-hand side of the screen and select "All Address Books".

Rather than start over again and create new profiles, how can I correct this problem, i.e. easily restore my profiles?

Note: I've created a "XXXXXXXX.Default User" zip file using the program's internal export function, but, oddly enough, the folder that was created for this is "0 KB" in size.

I've also made a backup of my "profiles" folder, which is huge: over 9 GB in size.

I look forward to hearing from you!

Thanks in advance,

Paul
creator: paulcohen
